items.content_html:
So with these new law changes coming eventually to social media, including the need to verify ourselves with ID to prove our age - how does that look for #Mastodon and other #Fediverse social media? In particular the larger instances that have responsibility to its user base under their own countries laws?

I don’t think this would affect small private servers in any way, but I’m interested to know more…

items.content_html:
To my fellow #privacy focused individuals. I’ve been using a #Fitbit for some time, and as you are aware, #Google purchased the brand a while ago now, and I have been #De-Googling my life.

What solutions have you found for #fitnesstracking? I’d be interested to know about any #OpenSource tracking options that work well with GPS and hiking apps such as #Alltrails, or other alternatives.

I’m new to this area of privacy! Beyond just taking the tracker off completely and going without.
items.content_text:

What solutions have you found for #fitnesstracking? I'd be interested to know about any #OpenSource tracking options that work well with GPS and hiking apps such as #Alltrails, or other alternatives.

I'm new to this area of privacy! Beyond just taking the tracker off completely and going without.

items.content_html: If you followed me for photography but notice I now boost varied content, follow my photo-only account: photos.familylison.com/@sporetra… Feel free to unfollow here if uninterested. This account will share daily thoughts on diverse topics. #PixelFed is for photography; Mastodon for thoughts and long-form hike/photo posts.
items.content_text: If you followed me for photography but notice I now boost varied content, follow my photo-only account: [photos.familylison.com/@sporetra...](https://photos.familylison.com/@sporetrail.) Feel free to unfollow here if uninterested. This account will share daily thoughts on diverse topics. #PixelFed is for photography; Mastodon for thoughts and long-form hike/photo posts.

items.title: My First Photos!
items.content_html:
This post is basically a re-post of some of my favourite photos so that you are able to find them.

When I transitioned my website from using Wordpress to Micro.blog I lost access to my old posts and the media I had uploaded to that server.

Luckily, I only had 3 articles so far, as I was still finishing my web design and waiting on some new gear to go out and photograph with.

Below are my favourite photos that were all taken using a Nikon D7000 while out hiking in various locations of Victoria.

I will make all of these photos available on my Patron page for FREE. You can become a member for free and download all of these in their original format.

They may not currently be in 16:9 ratio and optimized for Social Media content, but these are my first attempts at photography and will always hold a #nostalgic place to me.

I am sure that you will enjoy these. Please let me know in the comments what you think.
items.content_text: This post is basically a re-post of some of my favourite photos so that you are able to find them. When I transitioned my website from using Wordpress to Micro.blog I lost access to my old posts and the media I had uploaded to that server. Luckily, I only had 3 articles so far, as I was still finishing my web design and waiting on some new gear to go out and photograph with. Below are my favourite photos that were all taken using a **Nikon D7000** while out hiking in various locations of Victoria. I will make all of these photos available on my [Patron](https://https://www.patreon.com/thesporetrail) page for FREE. You can become a member for free and download all of these in their original format. They may not currently be in 16:9 ratio and optimized for Social Media content, but these are my first attempts at photography and will always hold a #nostalgic place to me. I am sure that you will enjoy these. Please let me know in the comments what you think.

items.content_html: Project completed. Ethernet cable routed through my double story house, with switches, to our NBN fiber modem connection. Now enjoying 1000Mbps speeds direct to the PC, instead of what I was getting, 300 via WiFi mesh.
items.content_text: Project completed. Ethernet cable routed through my double story house, with switches, to our NBN fiber modem connection. Now enjoying 1000Mbps speeds direct to the PC, instead of what I was getting, 300 via WiFi mesh.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->

Fediverse is an important step in the freedom of the internet and owning our own data.

I enjoy sharing my photos on Pixelfed where there are no algorithms, likes and views.
I’m still having fun making this new website. Lots of coding. I have not done HTML in more than 25 years! Take a look if you like and let me know your thoughts. samuellison.com
items.content_text:
I'm still having fun making this new website. Lots of coding. I have not done HTML in more than 25 years!
Take a look if you like and let me know your thoughts. [samuellison.com](https://samuellison.com)

items.content_html: Interesting. Though when it comes to WiFi and Bluetooth, make sure that you also turn off WiFi and Bluetooth scanning, as those run in the background even with WiFi and Bluetooth off and allow your devices to be found.

I’ve decided to support the fediverse and indieweb movements more by transitioning my website and online identity, own my own data and POSSE my posts across the various social media silos and make use of Webmentions. Still a lot of work to go, but making my own HTML is fun! Https://samuellison.com
items.content_text: I've decided to support the fediverse and indieweb movements more by transitioning my website and online identity, own my own data and POSSE my posts across the various social media silos and make use of Webmentions. Still a lot of work to go, but making my own HTML is fun! Https://samuellison.com

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
While trying to get fit, I've been adding 30 minutes of jump rope / skipping to my daily routine and I put on hardstyle trance music. The last track however, happened to be 240bpm, that's 4 beats per second. Meaning, I was jumping and hitting the floor 4 times per second to this particular track.

I'm buggered.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
A New Printer: Will this mean I start making my own prints?
So just the other day, my step-father purchased a new photo printer as he‚Äôs an avid professional photographer and makes a lot of photo prints for his clients and for the family.
I was lucky enough to be gifted with his old printer, which is a tried and tested Epson Photo Stylus R3000.
Fun with Aspect Ratios ‚Ä¶
https://www.samuellison.com/a-new-printer/

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I am moving away from YouTube for my hiking and photography channel.
My videos are currently importing and syncing with my existing channel, and I will shut down the YouTube channel once all that is done. I've been moving away from centralized social media over the last few months which works fine for me, as I've never been one to care about views, likes or shares, but more into community which the Fediverse definitely has show me it has: https://makertube.net/c/thesporetrail/videos

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
And this is my daily runner and my editing setup. Bit of a creation HUB for live streaming as well for a game I have been working on for years.

This system runs Pop!_OS and a 43 inch 4k HDR monitor.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
My new printing station. I got gifted an Epson Stylus Photo R3000, so happy!

Got some old monitors and a laptop HUB and will use this space purely for printing purposes. The laptop is running Windows to cover me for windows native apps I still use for certain tasks.

I can do up to A3 prints and in rolls too for panoramic.

items.content_text: üèûÔ∏è Conquered the steep climb up Lerderderg Gorge Circuit with a 15kg ruck! üí™ Sweating like my 20s all over again, but loving every moment. The views, the challenge, and the solitude made it all worth it. Pushing limits, embracing adventure, and savouring the journey! üåø #LerderdergGorge #RuckingChallenge #HikingAdventures #TheSporeTrail #NatureLover

items.content_text: üåÑ Tomorrow, I'm taking on the Lerderderg Gorge Circuit‚Äîan 8km loop with a challenging 387m elevation gain! This hike has been on my list for a while, and I‚Äôm excited to tackle it as part of my growing love for hiking on my days off work. üí™üèûÔ∏è Stay tuned‚ÄîI‚Äôll share some photos from the adventure! üåøüçÇ #HikingAdventures #LerderdergGorge #NatureLover #TrailLife #TheSporeTrail #ExploreOutdoors

I am new to #photography and I have been learning on a #nikon camera for now that is more than 14 years old.

Here is one of my favourite photos so far of some #mushrooms in one of my local state forests while on a #hike. What do you think for a beginner?

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: OK, so I did it. I #degoogled my phone and installed #grapheneos. Let's see how I like it and how long it takes to get a real hang of it. Whole new shift from X and Facebook to my own instance of Mastodon... New OS... Its my data! Going to setup a #nas and take back all my photos too.

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: Can I ask. Is #mastodon (and the rest of the #fediverse ) generally like this? Where you can have actual meaningful conversations with others instead of being bombarded with algorithmic junk for views and likes?

items.content_html: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text: üåø Hi, I‚Äôm Samuel Lison! A #NaturePhotographer & hiker, exploring the beauty of #fungi, #landscapes, & the #outdoors. I‚Äôm new to #Mastodon & excited to connect with a thoughtful community. I share #photography from my adventures, #hikes through serene trails, and insights into my journey of learning, growth, and mindful living. Let‚Äôs celebrate nature‚Äôs wonders, discover new perspectives, and build genuine connections beyond algorithms. üå±üì∏ #Introduction #HikingAdventures #TheSporeTrail
